intro: Kadua degeneri, commonly known as the yellow kadua, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated by insects. Kadua degeneri is an important part of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
